remarks: An infinite initial ordinal is characterized by the property of being initial - that is, it is a subset of any dominating ordinal. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 29-Oct-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 20-Sep-2014.)
statement:
alephinit $p |- ( ( A e. On /\ _om C_ A ) -> ( A e. ran aleph <-> A. x e. On ( A ~<_ x -> A C_ x ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
